conclusion: The car travels at 30 m/s and the truck at 10 m/s, with the truck 30 meters ahead.
The v-t graph shows the car's speed decreasing from 30 m/s to 10 m/s and the truck maintaining a constant speed of 10 m/s.
The area under the car's v-t graph represents the distance traveled by the car, which is 30 meters.
Since the truck is already 30 meters ahead and maintains a constant speed, the car will not catch up to the truck.
The two cars will not collide.
